Uses of Persistent in dungeon.collections
 

Classes in dungeon.collections that implement Persistent
 class AttackList
          A collection of Attack objects
 class CreatureList
          A collection of Creature objects
 class FactionList
          A collection of Faction objects
 class TileList
          A collection of Tile objects
 class TreasureList
          A collection of Treasure objects
 

Uses of Persistent in dungeon.model
 

Classes in dungeon.model that implement Persistent
 class Game
          Class to hold game state information
 

Uses of Persistent in dungeon.model.combat
 

Classes in dungeon.model.combat that implement Persistent
 class Attack
           
 class Dagger
          Ranged hero attack
 class Longbow
          Ranged hero attack
 class Smash
          Melee creature attack
 class Sword
          Melee hero attack
 

Uses of Persistent in dungeon.model.items
 

Classes in dungeon.model.items that implement Persistent
 class Item
          An item in the dungeon
Derived classes are: Mob (for mobile items such as creatures) Treasure (for collectable treasure items)
 

Uses of Persistent in dungeon.model.items.mobs
 

Classes in dungeon.model.items.mobs that implement Persistent
 class Creature
          Class representing a creature
Derived classes are Orc and Ogre
 class Faction
          Class to hold information about a mob faction.
 class Hero
          The user-controlled hero mob
 class Mob
          Abstract class to represent any mobile item in the dungeon
Derived classes are Hero and Creature
 class Ogre
          An ogre; stronger and tougher than an orc, but slower
 class Orc
          An orc; relatively easy to kill
 

Uses of Persistent in dungeon.model.items.treasure
 

Classes in dungeon.model.items.treasure that implement Persistent
 class Gold
          A pile of coins
 class Key
          A key to a door in the dungeon
Keys can be generic, or can be tied to a specific door
 class Potion
          A potion that affects the drinker in some way
Could be a health potion or an energy potion
 class Treasure
          Class representing an item of treasure in the dungeon
 

Uses of Persistent in dungeon.model.structure
 

Classes in dungeon.model.structure that implement Persistent
 class Door
          A door tile
Doors can be open, closed or locked
Note: By default, locked doors are opened by any key; this can be overridden
 class Finish
          The finish tile
If the hero enters this tile, the user wins the game
 class FlameTrap
           
 class Floor
           
 class Map
          Class containing the list of tiles which make up the dungeon
 class Pit
           
 class Tile
          A tile is an area on the map, such as a room or a door

Methods in dungeon.utils with type parameters of type Persistent
static
<T extends Persistent>
void
XMLHelper.loadObject(Node parent, String name, T obj)
          Load a Persistent object from the given XML node
static
<T extends Persistent>
void
XMLHelper.saveObject(Node parent, String name, T obj)
          Save a Persistent object to the given XML node
static
<T extends Persistent>
void
XMLHelper.saveVector(Node parent, String name, Vector<T> vec)
          Save a vector of Persistent objects to the given XML node
 

Methods in dungeon.utils with parameters of type Persistent
static String Persistence.getXML(Persistent object)
          Returns the XML data for a Persistent object
static void Persistence.loadFromXML(String filename, Persistent object)
          Load the specified object from the given XML file
static void Persistence.saveToXML(String filename, Persistent object)
